rooms.name: North-facing Entrance Hall
rooms.description: The main entrance is designed with a bold, minimalist approach typical of Brutalist architecture. The space leads directly into the central living area and is positioned on the north side to harness optimal natural light.
rooms.vastu_considerations: North placement encourages positive energy flow.

rooms.name: Living Room
rooms.description: An expansive area with concrete exposed finishes and large windows for ample daylight. Designed to connect with the outdoor space.

rooms.name: Kitchen
rooms.description: A functional, modern kitchen designed in Brutalist style with raw materials and efficient layout. Adjacent to dining area for convenience.
rooms.vastu_considerations: South-eastern placement recommended for energy and fire elements.

rooms.name: Master Bedroom
rooms.description: A spacious bedroom featuring concrete walls, minimalistic design, and a focus on calm ambiance. Includes built-in storage.

rooms.name: Second Bedroom
rooms.description: A comfortable bedroom designed with a focus on simplicity and functionality, aligning with the overall Brutalist aesthetic.
rooms.vastu_considerations: South-western placement to balance dynamic energy.

rooms.name: Third Bedroom (Guest Room)
rooms.description: A modestly sized guest bedroom that complements the main living spaces.

rooms.name: Bathroom
rooms.description: A modern, minimalist bathroom with exposed concrete finishes and essential fixtures designed for functionality.

rooms.name: Library
rooms.description: A dedicated library space with built-in bookshelves, ample lighting, and a contemplative atmosphere. The room features large windows to capture natural light.
rooms.vastu_considerations: South-eastern or central placement for intellectual stimulation.

rooms.name: Home Office
rooms.description: A dedicated home office designed to promote focus and productivity, featuring ergonomic furniture and natural light. This space is slightly secluded from the main living area.
rooms.vastu_considerations: North-eastern placement is ideal for intellectual energy.

openings.description: Main entrance door designed in a Brutalist style with reinforced concrete and glass elements.
Large windows to bring ample natural light into the living room.
Strategically placed kitchen window to enhance airflow and lighting.
Balanced window design ensuring adequate ventilation across bedrooms.
Access point to the rooftop terrace, integrated within the living space for ease of movement.

rooms.name: Rooftop Terrace
rooms.description: An expansive outdoor area designed to serve as a relaxation and socializing space. Features concrete finishes, seating areas, and minimalistic landscaping.
rooms.vastu_considerations: North-eastern exposure is ideal for balancing energies.

openings.description: Stairs leading from the ground floor to the rooftop terrace, designed for easy access while maintaining a Brutalist aesthetic.
